title: First Degree Speeding
description: Drives in excess of the speed limit by more than 55 miles per hour. Adds 3 points.

title: Assault & Battery
description: Openly threatens violoence or injury upon an individual either orally or through their actions and acts upon that threat.

title: Criminal Threats
description: A criminal threat is when you threaten to kill or physicall harm someone. That person is thereby placed in a state of reasonably sustained fear for his/her safety or for the safety of his/her immediate family, the threat is specific and unequivocal andyou communicate the threat verbally, in writing, or via an electronically transmitted device.

title: Brandishing of a Firearm
description: Displaying a firearm in public without a legal reason. 'Open Carry' is not a legal reason to have a weapon in your hand. To open carry, the weapon must be holstered or attached to a sling.

title: Unlawful Imprisonment
description: Restricts a persons movement within any area without legal authority, justification, or the persons consent.

title: Murder Of A Government Employee
description: The intentional act that leads to the death of a Government Employee. The following titles qualify an individual as a government employee: Law Enforcement Officer, Emergency Medical Services Personnel, Doctor, Judge, Mayor, Deputy Mayor, and County Clerk.

title: Grand Theft Auto
description: Taking another person's vehicle without their consent.

title: Driving Under the Influence (DUI)
description: Operating a vehicle while under the influence of alcohol or drugs.

title: Possession of Controlled Substance
description: Having illegal drugs or narcotics in one's possession.

title: Breaking and Entering
description: Illegally entering a building or property with the intent to commit a crime.

title: Trespassing
description: Entering or remaining on someone else's property without permission.

title: Public Intoxication
description: Being visibly intoxicated in a public place.

title: Resisting Arrest
description: Physically or verbally resisting a lawful arrest.
